Text:
I just *solved this problem* and *created an open source repository* [hosted on GitHub](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch) using my solution. It's called **BartyCrouch** (like the *Harry Potter* character who speaks over 200 languages) and can be easily installed via Homebrew by running:

    brew tap flinesoft/bartycrouch
    brew install flinesoft/bartycrouch/bartycrouch

Now you can **manually run commands** like

    bartycrouch -in "path/Base.lproj/Main.storyboard" -out "path/en.lproj/Main.strings"
    bartycrouch -in "path/Base.lproj/Main.storyboard" -out "path/en.lproj/Main.strings,path/de.lproj/Main.strings"
    bartycrouch -in "path/Base.lproj/Main.storyboard" -all

to update your `.strings` files or add a **run script build phase** to your target like 

    if which bartycrouch > /dev/null; then
        # Set path to base internationalized storyboards
        BASE_PATH="$PROJECT_DIR/Sources/User Interface/Base.lproj"
    
        # Incrementally update all storyboards strings files
        bartycrouch -in "$BASE_PATH/Main.storyboard" -all
        bartycrouch -in "$BASE_PATH/LaunchScreen.storyboard" -all
    else
        echo "BartyCrouch not installed, download it from https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch"
    fi
    
to update all your `.strings` files **automatically on each build**. Don't forget to update the `BASE_PATH` to the path of your base internationalized storyboards.

Please note that BartyCrouch **overwrites existing `.strings` files** and could potentially lead to loss of translations content. So please make sure you **commit your code regularly**.

Read the **documentation of the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch)** for more detailed instructions. This solution fits my needs well, if it doesn't serve yours feel free to open an issue on GitHub. I hope this helps some people out there!

---

Here is how BartyCrouch works:

- run `ibtool` to generate temporary `.strings` file for storyboard
- read translations of existing `.strings` files and new temporary file
- rewrite existing `.strings` files using keys from temp file
- while rewriting: keep all existing translations and one-line comments

Basically put: As long as you didn't change the structure of the `.strings` files automatically created by Interface Builder, BartyCrouch should work well for you.

    brew tap flinesoft/bartycrouch

    bartycrouch -in "path/Base.lproj/Main.storyboard" -out "path/en.lproj/Main.strings,path/de.lproj/Main.strings"
    bartycrouch -in "path/Base.lproj/Main.storyboard" -all # finds strings files automatically

    if which bartycrouch > /dev/null; then

    fi

Please note that BartyCrouch **overwrites existing `.strings` files** and could potentially lead to loss of translations content. So please make sure you **commit your code regularly**.

- run `ibtool` to generate temporary `.strings` file for storyboard
- read translations of existing `.strings` files and new temporary file
- delete generated temporary `.strings` file
- rewrite existing `.strings` files using keys from temp file

---

Here is how BartyCrouch works internally:

- run `ibtool` to generate temporary `.strings` file for storyboard
- read translations of existing `.strings` files and new temporary file
- delete generated temporary `.strings` file
- rewrite existing `.strings` files using keys from temp file
- while rewriting: keep all existing translations and one-line comments

Basically put: As long as you didn't change the structure of the `.strings` files automatically created by Interface Builder, BartyCrouch **should work well for you**. If you *did* change the structure it *might* still work, but you should **test it first** and compare the states before and after running BartyCrouch.

I *created an open source repository* [hosted on GitHub](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch) which solves this problem. You can easily install it via [Homebrew](http://brew.sh) by running the commands:

    brew tap flinesoft/bartycrouch
    brew install flinesoft/bartycrouch/bartycrouch

Now you can either **manually run** commands like these:

    # finds and updates all localized Storyboards/XIBs
    bartycrouch -s "/absolute/path/to/project"
 
    # only updates specified languages for specified Storyboard
    bartycrouch -i "path/Base.lproj/Main.storyboard" -o en de pt-BR


You can also simply add the following **run script build phase** to your target ([instructions](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch#build-script)) to update all your `.strings` files **automatically on each build**:

    if which bartycrouch > /dev/null; then
        # Incrementally update all Storyboards/XIBs strings files
        bartycrouch -s "$PROJECT_DIR"
    else
        echo "warning: BartyCrouch not installed, download it from https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch"
    fi

   

I *highly recommend* **the build script method**.

Please note that BartyCrouch **overwrites existing `.strings` files** and could potentially lead to loss of translations content. So please make sure you **commit your code regularly**.

BartyCrouch **uses `ibtool` internally** for extracting localized strings from interface builder files.
Comment: Updated code to BartyCrouch 2.0 + Streamlined answer

Text:
I *created an open source repository* [hosted on GitHub](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch) which solves this problem. You can easily install it via [Homebrew](http://brew.sh) by running the commands:

    brew tap flinesoft/bartycrouch
    brew install flinesoft/bartycrouch/bartycrouch

Now you can either **manually run** commands like these:

    # finds and updates all localized Storyboards/XIBs
    bartycrouch -s "/absolute/path/to/project"
 
    # only updates specified languages for specified Storyboard
    bartycrouch -i "path/Base.lproj/Main.storyboard" -o en de pt-BR


Or you can also simply add the following **run script build phase** to your target ([instructions](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch#build-script)) to update all your `.strings` files **automatically on each build**:

    if which bartycrouch > /dev/null; then
        # Incrementally update all Storyboards/XIBs strings files
        bartycrouch -s "$PROJECT_DIR"
    else
        echo "warning: BartyCrouch not installed, download it from https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch"
    fi

   

I *highly recommend* **the build script method**.

Please note that BartyCrouch **overwrites existing `.strings` files** and could potentially lead to loss of translations content. So please make sure you **commit your code regularly**.

BartyCrouch **uses `ibtool` internally** for extracting localized strings from interface builder files.

I *created an open source repository* [hosted on GitHub](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch) which solves this problem. You can easily install it via [Homebrew](http://brew.sh) by running the commands:

    brew tap flinesoft/bartycrouch
    brew install flinesoft/bartycrouch/bartycrouch

Now you can either **manually run** commands like these:

    # finds and updates all localized Storyboards/XIBs
    bartycrouch interfaces -p "/absolute/path/to/project"


Or you can also simply add the following **run script build phase** to your target ([instructions](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch#build-script)) to update all your `.strings` files **automatically on each build**:

    if which bartycrouch > /dev/null; then
        # Incrementally update all Storyboards/XIBs strings files
        bartycrouch interfaces -p "$PROJECT_DIR"
    
        # Add new keys to Localizable.strings files from NSLocalizedString in code
        bartycrouch code -p "$PROJECT_DIR" -l "$PROJECT_DIR" -a
    else
        echo "warning: BartyCrouch not installed, download it from https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch"
    fi

 

I *highly recommend* **the build script method**.

Please note that BartyCrouch **overwrites existing `.strings` files** and could potentially lead to loss of translations content. So please make sure you **commit your code regularly**.

BartyCrouch **uses `ibtool` internally** for extracting localized strings from interface builder files.

Checkout **[BartyCrouch](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch)**, it perfectly solves your problem. Also it is **open source**, **actively maintained** and can be **easily installed and integrated** within your project.

---

**Install** BartyCrouch via [Homebrew](http://brew.sh):

    $ brew tap flinesoft/bartycrouch
    $ brew install flinesoft/bartycrouch/bartycrouch

**Incrementally update** your Storyboards/XIBs Strings files:

    $ bartycrouch interfaces -p "/absolute/path/to/project"

This will do exactly what you were looking for.

---

In order to **keep** your Storyboards/XIBs Strings files **updated over time** I highly recommend adding a build script (instructions on how to add a build script [here](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch#build-script)):

    if which bartycrouch > /dev/null; then
        # Incrementally update all Storyboards/XIBs strings files
        bartycrouch interfaces -p "$PROJECT_DIR"
    
        # Add new keys to Localizable.strings files from NSLocalizedString in code
        bartycrouch code -p "$PROJECT_DIR" -l "$PROJECT_DIR" -a
    else
        echo "warning: BartyCrouch not installed, download it from https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch"
    fi

In addition to incrementally updating your Storyboards/XIBs Strings files this will also **make sure your `Localizable.strings` files stay updated** with newly added keys in code using `NSLocalizedString`.

Make sure to checkout BartyCrouch on [GitHub](https://github.com/Flinesoft/BartyCrouch) for additional information.
